agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 9am-7pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Wed and Fri 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Northeastern Center helps individuals in northeastern Indiana achieve emotional and mental wholeness through accessible, affordable and quality behavioral health services.
service_name: OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES - STEUBEN COUNTY
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anxiety, bi-polar disorder, depression, obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), panic disorder, personality disorder, or post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.

site_details: Walk in during designated hour or call the office for information or to schedule an appointment.

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for Steuben County. agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years-old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older -- Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Steuben County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; Open

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization providing a homeless shelter.
service_description: Provides emergency shelter for homeless people and families in Steuben County and surrounding areas. Case management services, including assistance with finding employment, and long-term housing, parenting, nutrition and budget classes are provided to shelter residents. Maximum length of stay is limited to 60 days.
site_details: Call to check on availability and to request an interview.
site_eligibility: Homeless men, women, and married couples with or without children -- Without a sexual or violent offense conviction

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents of Fremont, Jamestown, and Clear Lake townships in Steuben County. Circulates books, eBooks, periodicals, audio books, CDs, and DVDs. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Fremont, Jamestown or Clear Lake Townships or Fremont Community Schools

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs in Steuben County.
service_description: Maintains and operates two public housing complexes (Elliot Manor and Northlake Manor) for low-income families, seniors, and persons with disabilities in Steuben County. Application required; wait list may apply. Rent is calculated as percentage of monthly adjusted income.
site_details:
? Visit the website [https://bit.ly/AHA_FullApp] to download and print application. 
? Submit completed application and all required documents by postal mail, email, fax, or office drop box.
? Staff will review materials and reach out to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: US citizens and eligible immigrants living in Steuben County -- Household income at or below 80% of area median income -- With satisfactory criminal history as determined by assessment

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing nutritious meals to persons who are homebound, ill, or disabled who are unable to prepare meals.
service_description: Delivers hot, midday meals each weekday to homebound persons in need. Offers a variety of meals based on dietary needs.
site_details: Call for information or to request services.
site_eligibility: Living in the city of Angola in Steuben County -- Age 50 or older -- Persons with a disability -- Unable to prepare meals

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides subsidized,one-bedroom rental apartments in Steuben County to income-eligible persons who are age 62 or older. No pets are allowed. Applications are accepted on a walk-in basis. A wait list is maintained when all units are full. Rent amount is equal to 30% of the resident's adjusted gross income.
site_details: Walk in or call for information. -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: Walk in or call for information. Must wear a mask and follow social distancing guidelines per the CDC.
site_eligibility: Age 62 or older -- Low income -- Able to pass criminal background check

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.

site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.

site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Traffic tickets issued in Steuben County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Steuben County, Magistrate Court handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Steuben County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Steuben County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Steuben County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.

agency_name: CLEAR LAKE TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - STEUBEN COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: CLEAR LAKE TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - STEUBEN COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: County department that answers the dispatch calls for all fire, police and medical assistance in Steuben County, excluding Angola City Police and Fire Department.
service_description: Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Steuben County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the 24-hour, nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Steuben County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers long-term shelter and support services for women and children who are fleeing domestic violence.
service_description: Provides shelter for women (with or without children) who are victims of domestic violence or sexual assault. Support services include case management, domestic abuse counseling, life-skills coaching, and employment information. Women may access child care services up to six months after leaving the shelter. Limited transportation may be available on a case by case basis. Length of stay ranges between 6 to 18 months.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment; after-hours leave a message for a return call.
site_eligibility: Women with or without children (up to age 12) -- Fleeing domestic violence or victims of sexual assault -- Sober 72 hours prior to admission
